title: RE: Nord Sample Library 2.0  dont work with Nord Stage2
post_content: Do you use the latest version of the Nord Sound Manager and Nord Stage 2 firmware/OS?Nord Sound Manager v7.42Nord Stage 2 v3.00 (you need at least OS 2.06 for supporting v2 samples)v2.06 (2015-04-30)Displaying category only for NSMP files with proper category info (i.e. hiding category for format f1).Supporting new NSMP format 2.Showing NSMP categories in parameter hint.Fixed so NSMP reports Format.Revison to managerAdded support for NS2EX hardwareImproved reliability of USB MIDI, also improved reliability of USB sleep/resume behaviour.Gr Bart

title: RE: Nord Sample Library 2.0  dont work with Nord Stage2
post_content: Be sure to select the correct tab in the Manager !If you want to download samples (.nsmp), be sure to select the Synth tab.If it's piano/EP sounds (,npno), select the piano tab.You'll see the extension when selecting file and this should help you know you're not in the correct tab.Fred

title: RE: Piece Of The Rock - Mother's Finest
post_content: I'd suggest for most Mother's Finest synth work you won't need much more than a sawtooth oscillator, unison, and a low pass filter with mod-wheel controlled cutoff - season your resonance to taste.  He often uses two oscillators one or two octaves apart, and pitch bend set to an octave.  We have Baby Love in our set list at the moment, fun song!

title: Wavetable and FM Synthesis for NS2
post_content: Could anyone share patches with Wavetable or FM synthesis for Nord Stage 2 without the use of samples please?Well I did not find much here in the forum about this and I would like to try this part of the NS2 synthesizer.Some cool examples of programs would be EPs, leads, synth bass, synth brass and etc ...

title: RE: Wavetable and FM Synthesis for NS2
post_content: I suggest you look into the Factory Synth programs first, you'll find some good examples thereConsider also that in the NS2 Synth, FM and Wavetable are only related to the Osc, so the waveform generation, the rest (Filter, LFO, ...) are the same as when you use the VA oscillator waveforms.

title: RE: Wavetable and FM Synthesis for NS2
post_content: The NS2 does not have a wavetable oscillator. It has lots of one-cycle waves. That is very different from a wavetable.

title: RE: Wavetable and FM Synthesis for NS2
post_content: Mr_-G- wrote:The NS2 does not have a wavetable oscillator. It has lots of one-cycle waves. That is very different from a wavetable.From NS2 manual;(...)powerful oscillator section for the Stage 2 synthesizer . Based on a variable architecture, it provides four different oscillator techniques: Analog, FM (frequency modulation),digital wavetablesand sample playback.

title: RE: Wavetable and FM Synthesis for NS2
post_content: I found 1 or 2 FM patches in the factory programs of NS2, but from wavetable I did not find any, if anyone had any tips speak here.

title: RE: Wavetable and FM Synthesis for NS2
post_content: Come on, maxpiano, you know this. Wavetables is a different type of synthesis.https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wavetable_synthesisThere is no way of doing anything other than using the waveform as a standard oscillator No interpolating across adjacent waves and so on which is where things start getting interesting.Do not get me wrong, I am happy that the Nord has a collection of waves, lots of interesting ones, but that is not proper wavetable synthesis.https://www.soundonsound.com/sound-advi ... -synthesis

title: RE: Wavetable and FM Synthesis for NS2
post_content: Mr_-G- wrote:Come on, maxpiano, you know this. Wavetables is a different type of synthesis.https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wavetable_synthesisThere is no way of doing anything other than using the waveform as a standard oscillator No interpolating across adjacent waves and so on which is where things start getting interesting.Do not get me wrong, I am happy that the Nord has a collection of waves, lots of interesting ones, but that is not proper wavetable synthesis.https://www.soundonsound.com/sound-advi ... -synthesisJust terminology Mr-G, I agree with you but it's not my or evandrolino's fault if at Nord they call them "wavetables"

title: RE: Help shaping a sound - percussive bubble
post_content: for true organ sine or triangle work best for bubble, plain, simple and ordinarythe "bubble" part you're talking in about in that Luciano tune is not a keyboard -- it's a drum synth.  your real key to getting that sound will be getting the amplitude envelope rightbless, pabloPS -- respek due to the MessenjahPPS -- I strongly disagree with KB mag interviewee suggesting that a reggae bubble should "swing" -- should strictly follow tempo without any hint of swing

post_content: Hi,I tried to read your story, but with the almost unreadable sentences I can tell you this:Check one ofthese tutorials on YouTube!GrBart

title: RE: trouble transferring sounds to my Nord Stage 2EX
post_content: I'm not sure if I'm understanding correctly, but it sounds like you are trying to load a sample to a Program location. I would suggest saving the file to your PC, check the name, open Sound Manager and go to the Samples tab (not Program tab) to load the sample file, view it in organize mode, and simply drag/drop the sample file to an open spot. I store all my new samples above all the stock samples. Once loaded, you can move back to working on the Stage 2 EX where the slot A or B Synth for any program can be set to use that new sample. Take care.

title: RE: trouble transferring sounds to my Nord Stage 2EX
post_content: Maybe you are trying to download a program to your Nord, but you don't have the samples that the program uses?For example, if I download a brass program which may have a couple of samples layered, with some reverb etc, I also need the samples themselves.Could that be it?  If not, be a little more specific in your description, or post a video? Thanks.

title: RE: trouble transferring sounds to my Nord Stage 2EX
post_content: Something is not clear : you don't upload samples (.nsmp) to a bank location (i.e. : All bank D).You upload a program (.ns2p) to a bank location.When you upload samples, they go in the sample section (select the correct tab in the Nord Manager).Then, you have to create a program that will use those samples by enabling the Synth section and select the sample at the location # it was assigned to when uploaded.Hope this makes sense. If not, then I suggest you check some youtube tutorial.Oui et Non et vive la FranceFred

title: RE: trouble transferring sounds to my Nord Stage 2EX

title: RE: trouble transferring sounds to my Nord Stage 2EX
post_content: Hello, one last thought: Anytime you load a sample and the program using it to your Nord Stage 2, you need to go to the synth section for that program (slot A and/or B intended for that sample) and make sure the synth points to the memory location where you saved the sample.  Say for example that my posted program uses a guitar sample stored in my Stage 2 sample memory location 175; if you downloaded them and saved the sample to your sample memory location 199, you would need to modify the synth in the downloaded program to point to memory location 199 (not 175) to play the sampled sound. I hope this helps - take care.

title: RE: locked out of heaven for ns2?
post_content: Hi,I'm not in front of my stage but my lead singer asked to play it half step down, so, if I transpose the whole song, the samples are being transposed as well right?And all the external synths played via the EXT section will transposed too, right?Just to make sure..

title: RE: locked out of heaven for ns2?
post_content: Quai34 wrote:... so, if I transpose the whole song, the samples are being transposed as well right?Just to make sure..No, the samples will not be transposed in that way your singer asked for. With tranpose you'll only "shift" samples on the keys to the left or right.Transpose is not working as a "pitch". So if your sample is assigned with different sounds in the original tonality, you can't transpose the tonality of all sounds with transpose.You have to pitch the sounds in the sample-editor and re-create a new sample.Greetz

title: RE: Rush - Subdivisions
post_content: Thanks to Gustavo, we have an excellent sweep sample that can’t be constructed on the Nord. As you’ve no doubt discovered, preset A:02:04 is Nord’s sad little embarassing half-hearted pathetic feeble lame baby weasel attempt. After I installed Gustavo’s excellent program on my NS2, my sadness turned to joy.Some tips for playing Tom Sawyer with this program:Note that the sweep keys (Slot A, A1 to F#3) are off by a third, i.e., the C key plays an E.To play the first bass sweep, play C3 and C2 in succession to get one sweep chasing the other.The rest of the keys in Slot A’s sample 119 (G3 to B5) are for the whole-note synth pads.Use the upper split (Slot B) to play the lead runs. Use the Mod wheel to adjust the brightness, and press down hard on the last note for the aftertouch vibrato (use the pitch stick to exagerrate it right before the guitar solo.)You may want to make Slot B active (blinking) so you can see the Mod wheel’s effect on the frequency filter.Muchas Gracias, Gustavo!

title: RE: Rush - Subdivisions
post_content: Eisenhans wrote:Some tips for playing Tom Sawyer with this program:Note that the sweep keys (Slot A, A1 to F#3) are off by a third, i.e., the C key plays an E.To play the first bass sweep, play C3 and C2 in succession to get one sweep chasing the other.Muchas Gracias, Gustavo!Was the third interval done on purpose or it happened  to be a plain mistake?(Can not see the logic behind it) But the patch is good.

title: RE: Don't You Want Me Baby - Human League
post_content: Here's a bunch of patches.The 'gated HPF' sound (the intro 16ths) is best played with a sequencer: the arpeggiator would be a possible, with the latch turned on, but (a) it doesn't sound right and (b) you wouldn't want to waste a slot just to have this playing away by itself...Sounds use both A and B slots and are split to different zones.The sample MP3s are only to demo the sounds, so ignore my bad playingLastly, these are pure synth patches, no samples involved, so you should be able to tweak away.I didn't do trhe main melody, but TBH you can probably get close with with one of the EPianos thus avoiding the need for another synth patch.Dont't_You_Want_Me_first2.mp3Dont't_You_Want_Me_2more.mp3

title: Moog Sound (Snarky Puppy - Thing Of Gold)
post_content: I've been searching a long time for the sound at 2:39 in this video (and in Shaun Martin's solo).Could anyone help me with this, as I am not incredibly experienced with the synth part of my Nord Stage 2 yet.Thanks in advance,Rasmus

title: RE: Moog Sound (Snarky Puppy - Thing Of Gold)
post_content: Hi Rasmus! Great song isn't it!Well, I don't have a Nord Stage 2, but I can explain how I got a similar sound on my Nord Lead 2, and hopefully you will be able to do it on your own. Here we go...Osc 1: sawOsc 2: saw - one octave upNo detuningEnable oscillator syncMix 50/50Filter: 24 dB low passFrequency: 9 o'clockResonance: 11 o'clockEnvelope amount: 10 o'clock (velocity disabled)Filter envelope - Attack 9 o'clock, Decay 12 o'clock, Sustain 4 o'clock, Release 9 o'clockAmp envelope - Attack 9 o'clock, Decay 12 o'clock, Sustain max, Release 9 o'clockLegato enabledPortamento Auto 10 o'clockLFO - Rate 1 o'clock, Triangle wave, amount connected to the expression wheelThat's about it. Sounds something like this (with a little reverb added in Logic):thingofgold.mp3Good luck!/a

title: Loading PROGRAMS of Stage 2 ex into STAGE 3 ?????
post_content: I recently purchased a Nord Stage 3 after being totally blown away by the brilliant and gorgeous NS2EX programs such as the 10cc "Not In Love" layers, Van Halen "Jump" patch, Rick Wakeman Minimoog/Mellotron split, K. Emerson synths, mellotron splits/layers, Peter Gabriel CP80, etc, etc, etc.Was MASSIVELY disappointed in the NS3 due to the absence of these and many other "classic rock" NS2ex programs. I was profoundly disappointed to the extent that I RETURNED the NS3 after my (admittedly inept/novice) feeble attempts to replicate above sounds failed. Got a "clearance" item NS2 EX-HA88 and am thrilled-except for the weight. Will of course keep for home use, but still really want a compact NS3 for band use. However, MUST have those NS2 sounds!!! Still, I really liked the expanded memory, new zones/"fades" and displays that I would like to try another one eventually, but ONLY if I can LOAD or recreate those FANTASTIC NS3 PROGRAMS. Any ideas on how to get them into the NS3?Is there a way to load the NS2ex PROGRAMS into the Stage 3? Any and all help/suggestions greatly appreciated.

title: RE: Loading PROGRAMS of Stage 2 ex into STAGE 3 ?????
post_content: No.Samples (nsmp) and pianos (npno) will work; programs and synth presets will not.You have four options:1. Learn your equipment2. Search the Nord stage 3 programs section of this forum, or ask for assistance there3. Pay for readymade programs if they’re available4. Stick with the Stage 2 series.1.-3. can be applied in any combination.FWIW, if you hold down “Shift” and twist any knob on the Stage 2, it will show you the value it’s set to.Write those values down (and the samples/modes used) for the patches you need, and see what the morph does (for patches like the 10cc mod wheel thing), and see if you can transfer those to the Stage 3.It won’t sound the same (the synth engines are very different, and the EQ works a little differently, and the Stage 3 is a lot more flexible while sounding brighter overall), but it will get you close.And you’ll learn A LOT about your machine.ALSO: Please don’t repost the same question all over the place. (Three times so far, if I see correctly)

title: Ambrosia - Biggest Part of Me - free to a good home
post_content: I just purchased a Nord Stage 3, so taking a little time to post some more programs from my Stage 2 EX that you might have fun with. Note that most of my programs use the control pedal morph even if only to bring instruments in and out of a mix. You may need some additional samples for some of the programs.The memory locations in my Nord Stage 2 EX for the samples used in the program are:Slot A - 79 - "SmlChoir Fem Ah_Soft_CL ste 2.0"Slot B - 197 - "Horns_MMM_BR 2.0"It doesn't matter which sample memory locations you store the new samples in your Nord Stage 2, just make sure that after you load a program, that you point the Slot A and/or Slot B Synth to the correct sample in your system. For example, if you load "Horns_MMM_BR 2.0" into your sample location 140 (197 in mine), then you just need to point Slot B to 140 rather than 197. I'll revise this post as needed based on questions, so feel free to comment.Take care.Horns_MMM_BR 2.0.nsmpSample - Horns(1.9 MiB) Downloaded 460 timesAmbrosiaBigPartW.ns2pProgram - Ambrosia - Biggest Part of Me by WannitBBBad(547 Bytes) Downloaded 310 timesAmbrosiaBigPartW - Biggest Part of Me.mp3LINK "Stage 2 - For Those New To Programming" -->nord-stage-2-programs-ns2p-ns2pb-files- ... 16863.html

title: 10 Classic Rock and Other Programs
post_content: I have had my Nord Stage 2 for a couple months now and have put together a few programs that you might find useful to work with.  Note that most of my programs use the control pedal morph even if only to bring instruments in and out of a mix.  You will need some additional samples for some of the programs.  I went to the Nord User Sample Collection athttp://www.norduserforum.com/nord_sample_collection.php(<-link) and addedpatch 250 "SteelGit Dvv4.nsmp"posted by DJKeys,patch 301 "DX7 Rhodes.nsmp"posted by ibljula, andpatch 399 "12String.nsmp"posted by Mr_-G- to my Nord Stage 2 sample memory.The memory locations in my Nord Stage 2 for the samples used in the programs are:52	DX Piano  (preloaded factory sample "DXPiano_ste_PH.nsmp")73	SynthPad1  (preloaded factory sample "SynthPad1_ste CLv4.nsmp")74	SynthPad2  (preloaded factory sample "SynthPad2_ste CLv4.nsmp")76 	White Noise  (preloaded factory sample "White Noise.nsmp")116	SteelGit Dvv4  (posted by DJKeys)120	12String  (posted by Mr_-G-)135 	DX7 Rhodes  (posted by ibljula)It doesn't matter which sample memory locations you store the new samples in your Nord Stage 2, just make sure that after you load a program, that you point the Slot A and/or Slot B Synth to the correct sample in your system - the information is provided with each program below.  Use the list above as a reference - for example, if you load "DX7 Rhodes" into your sample location 140 (135 in mine), then every reference to sample "135" below should be replaced with "140".  I'll revise this post as needed based on questions, so feel free to comment.Take care.I have two versions of a DX7 Rhodes below, the first uses sample 135 in slot A and sample 52 in slot B.  In the mp3 I start with the Program, then add the second DX, and then add a Hammond with Leslie and slow Tremolo:DX7 Rhodes W.mp3DX7 Rhodes     W.ns2pDX7 Rhodes with additional DX and B3 - WannitBBBad(547 Bytes) Downloaded 988 timesThe second DX7 Rhodes uses sample 135 in slot A and sample 74 in slot B.  In the mp3 I start with the DX, then add SynthPad2, and then add a Hammond with Leslie and slow Tremolo:DX7 Rhodes2 W.mp3DX7 Rhodes2    W.ns2pDX7 Rhodes2 with SynthPad2 and B3 - WannitBBBad(547 Bytes) Downloaded 899 timesThe next few use samples 116 and 120 for acoustic 6 and 12-string guitars.  First is a quick James Taylor 6-string sample 116 with piano and Hammond (sample 120 is in slot B but not active):James Taylor W.mp3James Taylor   W.ns2pSimple guitar patch with Piano/Organ on bottom split.(547 Bytes) Downloaded 802 timesNext are two versions of the Eagles Hotel California.  A real 12-string guitar has strings an octave apart on the lower 6 and in unison on the upper 6, so these programs have a 3-part split with the middle split emulating the "strings" an octave apart. Both programs use "Ital Harpsich 1A Short Str 5.0.npno" in the Piano section for part of the effect (note: make sure the program uses the correct Harpsichord after loading).  Version 1 uses sample 116 in slot A:Hotel Calif W.mp3Hotel Calif    W.ns2pHotel California V1 - Acoustic Guitar and 12 string - WannitBBBad(547 Bytes) Downloaded 830 timesVersion 2 is programmed a little differently and uses sample 120 in slot A:Hotel Calif2 W.mp3Hotel Calif2    W.ns2pHotel California V2 - 12 String Guitar - WannitBBBad(547 Bytes) Downloaded 850 timesThe last of the guitar Programs features the 6-string (116 in slot B) with a 12-string (120 in slot A) brought in with the control pedal:LedZep AcGuitarW.mp3LedZep AcGuitarW.ns2pAcoustic 6 and 12 String - WannitBBBad(547 Bytes) Downloaded 791 timesNext, a few classic rock programs - first, Foreigner's Waiting for a Girl with a Rhodes and Synth using SynthPad2 in slot A:Waiting4Girl W.mp3Waiting4Girl   W.ns2pForeigner - Waiting For a Girl - WannitBBBad(547 Bytes) Downloaded 1011 timesThe synthesizer in Emerson Lake and Palmer's From the Beginning:ELP FromBgning W.mp3ELP FromBgning W.ns2pEmerson Lake and Palmer - From the Beginning - Synth - WannitBBBad(547 Bytes) Downloaded 803 timesStarting from the factory "Fifth Wheel MW.ns2p", the next program is Abacab by Genesis with the organ and synthesizer 5ths.  A Sequential Circuits Prophet 10 was used on the original song for both parts, but I used a Hammond for the organ to free up the slot B Synth playing around with the features and effects (second part of the mp3).Abacab 5thWeelmW.mp3Abacab 5thWeelmW.ns2pGenesis Abacab 5ths and Multi-Effects on B - WannitBBBad(547 Bytes) Downloaded 794 timesLastly, here's a shot at the surf and strings in Grand Funk's I'm Your Captain / Closer to Home using the 76 White Noise sample in slot A and 73 SynthPad1 in slot B:Surf ImYurCptn W.mp3Surf ImYurCptn W.ns2pSurf and Strings - Grand Funk - Closer to Home - I'm Your Captain - WannitBBBad(547 Bytes) Downloaded 674 timesLINK "Stage 2 - For Those New To Programming" -->nord-stage-2-programs-ns2p-ns2pb-files- ... 16863.html

title: RE: 10 Classic Rock and Other Programs
post_content: I have OS v1.72 loaded as well.  I tried all types of Synth settings for SteelGit_DVv4 this morning and fairly confident that the sample is not the problem, more likely it's the 12String and the Harpsichord used.  The control pedal morph affects the 12-string volume in "LedZep AcGuitarW".  Without a control pedal, the Slot A Synth LEVEL with 12String should be all the way down with only the 6-string in Slot B sounding in the upper split; if that's not the case with the way your control pedal is assigned, I'd suggest resaving the program to open only using the Slot B SteelGit.In both Hotel Calif programs, I use "Ital Harpsich 1A Short Str 5.0.npno" in the Piano section as Harpsi 1 - that would be the first thing to check.  On the mp3, my right hand is playing notes in the middle split and a few reaching into the first octave of the upper split. The top 2 1/2 octaves on the keyboard aren't used but do sound like a Harpsichord if played. You can also adjust the Piano section LEVEL to taper off the Harpsichord volume to your taste.  The B3 heard in the mp3 is likely not sounding based upon the control pedal setting.Hope this helps.

I think I may just need to tweak the balance of volumes to get the final sound as your mp3.I have attached mp3 of what mine sounds like, apologies for playing skills. title: RE: 10 Classic Rock and Other Programs
post_content: Definitely getting there. I would suggest setting the Slot B Synth with the 6-Sting an octave higher to match up with the 12-string in Slot A. In the "LedZep AcGuitarW" program I used the EQ to take a little brightness off the 6-string as well. For setting up the split, I would suggest setting it so that the low "E" on the acoustic guitar is close to the bottom of the range so that you can't play notes too much lower than the natural tuning of the guitar.  Glad it's working for you - take care.

title: James Taylor - Every Day - free to a good home
post_content: I just purchased a Nord Stage 3, so taking a little time to post some more programs from my Stage 2 EX that you might have fun with. Note that most of my programs use the control pedal morph even if only to bring instruments in and out of a mix. You may need some additional samples for some of the programs.The memory locations in my Nord Stage 2 EX for the samples used in the program are:Slot A - noneSlot B - 187 - "SynthPad2__CL stereo 2.0"It doesn't matter which sample memory locations you store new samples in your Nord Stage 2, just make sure that after you load a program, that you point the Slot A and/or Slot B Synth to the correct sample in your system. For example, if you load "SynthPad2__CL stereo 2.0" into your sample location 140 (187 in mine), then you just need to point Slot B to 140 rather than 187. I'll revise this post as needed based on questions, so feel free to comment.Take care.JTEveryday MK1 W - James Taylor - Every Day.mp3JTEveryday MK1 W.ns2pProgram - James Taylor - Every Day by WannitBBBad(547 Bytes) Downloaded 221 timesSynthPad2__CL stereo 2.0.nsmpSample - SynthPad2(1.58 MiB) Downloaded 443 timesLINK "Stage 2 - For Those New To Programming" -->nord-stage-2-programs-ns2p-ns2pb-files- ... 16863.html

title: RE: Pink Floyd?
post_content: Keyboard / Electronics / Synthesizer gear (through the years)Farfisa Combo-Compact Organ (1964-1968) Early pre-Floyd days up until Saucerful of SecretsFarfisa Compact Duo Organ (1968-1973) From Saucerful of Secrets up until Dark Side of The MoonMellotron M400 Mark II (1968-1971) Used in Saucerful, Ummagumma, Atom Heart MotherYamaha C-7 Acoustic Grand Piano (1968-1979)  From early albums throughout the seventiesHammond M-102 'Spinet' Organ (1968-1972) From Saucerful until Obscured by CloudsHarmonium (1970-1982) Used in Madcap Laughs, Barrett, Meddle, Obscured By Clouds & The Final CutSteinway & Sons Baby Classical Grand Piano (1971- )  Pompeii, Dark Side and beyond…EMS VCS3 ‘Putney’ Synthesizer (1971) Used in MeddleFender Rhodes Stage 73/88 Mark I Electric Piano (1972-1973) Obscured by clouds & Dark SideEMS VCS3 Synthi A Synthesizer (1972-1973) Used in Obscured by Clouds & Dark Side of the MoonHammond RT-3 Two-Manual Console Organ (1972-1973) Dark Side Of The Moon sessionsARP Solina String Ensemble Synthesizer (1972-1977) Used in Obscured…, Wish You… & AnimalsWurlitzer EP-200 Electric Piano (1973-1975) Used in Dark Side & Wish You Were HereMOOG Minimoog Synthesizer (1973-1977)  Used in Dark Side, Wish You Were Here & AnimalsEMS Synthi Hi-Fli Guitar Synthesizer (1973-1977?)  Used in Dark Side tour and Wish You Were…Hammond B-3 / C-3 Organ (1973-1994)  From Wish You Were Here through to the Division Bell tourEMS VCS3 Synthi AKS Synthesizer (1973-1994) Used in Dark Side, Wish You…, Animals, … p.u.l.s.e.Hohner Clavinet D6 (1975-1978)  Used in Wish You Were Here, Animals & Wet DreamKorg VC-10 Vocoder  (1976-1977) Used in AnimalsRhodes Suitcase 73/88 Mark I Electric Piano (1976- ) Used in Animals, The Wall and beyond…Oberheim Four-Voice Synthesizer (1978)  Only used in Wet DreamSCI Prophet V Synthesizer (1979-1981)  Used in The Wall sessions and live showsARP Quadra / Oddysey Mark III Synthesizer (1980-1981) One of them used in The Wall showsYamaha CP-70 Electric Grand Piano (1980-1981)  Used in The Wall live showsFairlight CMI Series II Synthesizer/Sampler (1984) Only used in Zee - ConfüsionRoland Vocoder VP-330 Plus (1986-1987) Used in Momentary Lapse Of ReasonRoland Super JX (JX-10) Synthesizer (1986-1989) Used in Momentary Lapse album & toursKurzweil K250 Synthesizer/Sampler (1986-1990) Used in Lapse album/tours & in Knebworth  ‘90Kurzweil MIDIBoard MIDI Controller (1987-) Used in Lapse & Division Bell tours & Broken ChinaKurzweil K2000 Digital Synthesizer/Sampler (1993-)  Used in Division Bell & Broken ChinaKurzweil K2000VP Digital Synthesizer/Sampler (1994)  Used in the Division Bell tourAKAI S1100 Digital Sampler (1996- )  Used in Broken ChinaE-mu Proteus/2 (Orchestral) Sample Playback Module (1996- )  Used in Broken ChinaHammond XB-5 Portable Dual-Manual Digital Organ (1996- )  Used in Broken China

title: Program Cross Reference for NS2 and NS2 EX
post_content: I own a NS2 for gigging, recording and home practice. My church owns a newer NS2 EX that I play for worship services. My dilemma is that the factory program locations do not match for the NS2 and NS2 EX boards so each time I find a program that works for a particular song on my NS2 at home, I must check the listing of programs on the NS2 EX to determine if the location matches. Only about 1/3 of the program locations match. So my question is, has anyone mapped and cross referenced both keyboard factory program locations so I can quickly locate the same program on each instrument?

title: RE: Program Cross Reference for NS2 and NS2 EX
post_content: If I were you, I'd probably use the Nord Sound Manager and set up each NS2 / NS2EX to have the same Programs, at least all in the same Bank.The easiest way to do this would be to create a blank bank (Bank D is a duplicate bank) and put all the Programs you normally use in that Bank. Then you would upload your home Bank D sounds into your laptop, take it to the church unit and download those Programs into that instrument's Bank D.I have three different NS2 / NS2EX variations and this is how I make it happen, though I also dip into other Banks as I have a few hundred Programs I've made over the years.Also, I use the "SortMode" a lot - any special sounds I've made I save a "User" Category and then I can go into Category Sort to find all of those sounds alphabetically. I did a reunion gig with an older band and had to create a few dozen Programs for that which I wanted to keep separate from my other Programs. For those I saved them as "No Cat" and then they would be nicely sorted in their own space using Category Sort.I hope this helps.

title: RE: Program Cross Reference for NS2 and NS2 EX
post_content: Thanks Eric. That is a good idea however all of my S2 Bank D is full of programs saved by individual song names that I rearrange for each gig setlist. I guess I could dump these songs to something like Set List Maker to clear Bank D and use the internal Bank D for only program names, but I was trying to avoid relying on a computer to behave at my gigs.I have already manually cross-referenced some of the factory locations for Banks A-C on each machine (NS2 & NS2 EX). Some of the program names changed slightly between the 2 machines but are close enough to use as equals. If I complete it, I will post it here for others to use.

title: RE: Program Cross Reference for NS2 and NS2 EX
post_content: A couple of additional thoughts here as I've been using a NS2 live for multiple gigs since 2011 when they first hit the market (and this led me to obtain additional NS2 EX units - I'm a bit obsessed). I have never relied upon a computer at gigs. I've become more and more efficient with the way in which I use the Banks in my NS2 units along with the Sound Manager. I went through and identified any of the presets I wanted to keep but deleted the majority of them, opening up more than one Bank. This way I can use multiple Banks for different purposes and I have "snapshots" of my Programs that I save periodically in case I lose track of a particular Program. I'd say I do some degree of computer hookup/management on a monthly basis.It may take you a bit longer from scratch to optimize the programs you're using, but one tip is to use the Category feature so you could take all the Programs you use for various gigs and tag them as User or No Cat or whatever and then you can sort and filter them very easily, move them around and streamline into Banks. I'll try to take some screenshots of my Sound Manager connected to my NS2 to give you an idea of what I'm talking about. There is also another thread on the forum I'll find that goes into even greater depth about tips and tricks to best organizing on the NS2.

title: RE: Program Cross Reference for NS2 and NS2 EX
post_content: Here's another thread that has some more detailed ideas for managing the Banks/Programs in the NS2.http://www.norduserforum.com/nord-stage ... tml#p72251

title: RE: Program Cross Reference for NS2 and NS2 EX
post_content: All good ideas for the NS2. Compounding my setup problems is that the NS2 EX is a shared keyboard for the church so any customizing is frowned upon.It appears that much of the program name customizing could be avoided if Nord would make the NS3 'song mode' available for the NS2's. Additionally, if Nord offered a plug-in device (thumb drive, SS drive, etc.), that works across all models, to carry individual setup patches/songs, I would buy one. I know it's a lot to ask but I see it similar to plugging in USB devices to a computer where the device drivers load then the device operates properly. That way, I could walk up to any Nord machine and plug in my 'porta-patch' device and be up and running with my specific patches/songs from any Nord keyboard. There may be some limitations on older Nord models, but this would allow individual users to load their specific sound banks on any Nord keyboard...just thinking??

title: RE: Program Cross Reference for NS2 and NS2 EX
post_content: That would be great, but that’s essentially what the Nord Sound Manager does.Building that sort of capability into the board itself would require a complete redesign along with an interface to match, apart from the fact that the Nord has neither the hardware nor the software to be a USB host.

title: RE: Program Cross Reference for NS2 and NS2 EX
post_content: Could you perhaps save your own Bank D onto the computer using the Sound Manager, then install the full Nord Stage 2 EX banks into your own machine, and then transfer Bank D back onto the machine?The risk here is that some sounds may not work due to the EX‘s larger storage having more samples available...

title: RE: Program Cross Reference for NS2 and NS2 EX
post_content: As I understand Nord Sound Manager, it is primarily an interface to the keyboard 'guts' with all of the storage happening inside the machine. You can download/upload a bank using sound manager but I think the programs rely on the patch locations to remain constant in the other banks. I was actually thinking about an external solid state drive (SSD), or equivalent, that carries all of your personal patches and programs, and any current Nord machine can 'load' from the SSD and operate just like your 'home' machine...too much to ask?

title: RE: Program Cross Reference for NS2 and NS2 EX
post_content: The NS2 will reconcile the sounds it needs regardless of the order in which Programs are saved or which Bank they are saved in - the only dependency when using multiple instruments is ensuring that the piano samples and synth samples that you are using are resident in each instrument. If they are missing, the Sound Manager will actually throw up an orange box by the Program indicating what's missing.

title: RE: Nutbush City Limits - Programm Bank
post_content: It’s a simple three-part split: Clavinet (one of the various presets should do), brass (again, one of the brass synth presets), and a simple moog-like synth sound (choose one from the synth presets) on the second slot. .I don’t play the song on the Stage (Mainstage for that one), but I have it set up with the Clavinet on the lower split, brass in the middle, and synth on top.It would work well with two splits, though: clav and brass on one layer, and solo synth on slot B.

title: Nord Stage 3 Synth Programming
post_content: Hey Folks. I have a Nord Stage 2 and some great sounds from the sample library that have been modified and stored as .ns2p files. CAN I TRANSFER THEM to my new Nord Stage 3. Apparently they are just settingsThought I d ask since I m unable to get the same sounds on the Nord Stage 3. Looking for super mellow stringy pads. Any help MASSIVELY appraiated

title: RE: Nord Stage 3 Synth Programming
post_content: Please use the search function, as this has been discussed many, many times.Short answer: No. The synth reacts very differently in the two machines.However, if you press and hold “shift” and turn a knob on the Stage 2, the display will show its value.You can use the same value settings on the new machine to get close, but they’ll still need some additional tweaking.

title: RE: Nord Stage 3 Synth Programming
post_content: Do you also know how I can show the current value settings on the nord stage 3 again?Because if I press and hold "shift" there the parameters are changing.

title: RE: Nord Stage 3 Synth Programming
post_content: There is a „Monitor“ button on the Stage 3 to do exactly that.

title: RE: "I Wish" and "Higher Ground"-Stevie Wonder sounds
post_content: For "I Wish", someone posted Youtube videos for all the separate tracks.There is a "synth" part in these tracks.The 16th notes in this "synth" part are swung, and they are essential to creating the groove of this song.Our band is trying to learn this song, and we have assigned this "synth" part to our lead guitarist.Note that while the "synth" 16th notes are swung, the 8th notes played by the bass are straight (not swung).Drums -Bass -"Synth" (cover via lead guitar?) -EP (cover via keys player or rhythm guitar player) -Horns -Vocals -We have two horn players in our band, and we are using our keyboard to create supplementary horn sounds with harmony voicings.I am using my separate Roland synth for this part of it, because of its (ridiculously) good split capabilities.But if you cover the EP part with one of your hands, and the horn attacks (harmonized) with your other hand,you should get a decent result.I would suggest using organ and/or EP sends as part of the noises for those "horn attacks".You might find that a combination of organ/EP sounds with a trumpet sound mixed works better than trying to create a horn only sound, if you have no horn players in your band. It is difficult to emulate the attack of a horn player via keys/synth.

title: RE: simply the best by tina turner
RE: simply the best by tina turner
post_content: The sound for the main keyboard riff on the intro and verses was a factory preset from a Roland D50 slightly edited. (I can't remember the name of it offhand). The bad news is that this sound is probably going to be next to impossible to replicate on a Stage. A quick Google tells me it was the "OK Chorale" preset. You might be better off trying to find a sample of the original D50 sound and use that.

title: RE: simply the best by tina turner
post_content: Hej Leo!Is this the one? (D50 samples, no 3 ...)http://sc-sounds.com/demo.html/AmicalementMichael @boringoffice.se

title: RE: simply the best by tina turner
post_content: Hi Marlowes - good detective work. I'm pretty sure that the OK Chorale 1 or 2 are the right samples. Those sorts of typical D50 sounds are a nightmare to try and copy with subtractive synthesis - even with a variety of digital waveforms as raw material, you just never capture them.As far as using these samples in "Simply The Best" is concerned, it's been a long time, but I remember more or less how it goes. You need to lower the VCA envelope sustain level a bit as the note volume should fade slightly while you're holding the notes, and then simply adjust release and maybe attack time to suit the track.The stabs on the intro and under the verse vocals are simply either lowish F octaves or F5 chord (F-C-F) - can't remember which. The answer riff between the lead vocal lines is 4 two-note chords: playing F at the bottom, the top notes of the chords are just C-D-E-F. So you've got C over F, D over F, E over F, F octave over F -  ie with F as the bass note, the high notes are just 5th, 6th, major 7th, octave. I think I doubled the chords in both hands an octave apart to thicken the sound. That should do the trick.

title: Pink Floyd Keep Talking Synth Effect
post_content: Hi,I'm looking for the synth effect that appear at the intro (that one with the delay, I don't know how to describe it) I make the lead using the FM synth, pan effect and attack (if some one need it I can share it) and I only need the sample to complete the intro.

title: RE: Pink Floyd Keep Talking Synth Effect
post_content: That is no talking synth, that is Stephen Hawkings computer assisted voiceDH

title: RE: Pink Floyd Keep Talking Synth Effect
post_content: If you're asking about the repeating noise "chewww chewww chewww" synth:— Noise as sound source,— 12 dB lowpass filter, resonance pretty high,— set the LFO to sawtooth (the lower waveform), slow — somewhere around 1.5 or 2 Hz (not kiloHertz),— apply LFO to filter with the "freq mod 1" knob.— set the "freq mod 2" knob to zero (middle).— adjust the Filter Frequency until it sounds right.If you want, set the amp attack to extremely short, and the release to fairly long.

title: RE: Pink Floyd Keep Talking Synth Effect
post_content: Yes, that's exactly what I'm lookong for. Thanks a lot.

title: RE: Elle King - Ex's and Oh's
post_content: Our band has decided to learn this song. I found this other video, which provides more views of when the keyboard player is playing and not playing, and shows that the distorted bass sound is not being made by the keys:So it seems that the bass sound being made by the keys is a more conventional synth bass sound - probably any relatively normal synth bass sound will do for this, since those low notes will also be played by a conventional bass guitar.More important is the high part. I ended up selecting a recorder sound on another synth I have (a Roland XV) because I cannot split my Electro 3. When I play recorder notes that high, they don't sound that different from the recording, and while playing this live, that will be plenty close enough.

post_content: There is no analog in this prog, only the DX7 II Wet Synth ste BR sample, so it should sound just like the sample sounds. With the left hand is 2 octave lower, playing an octave interval Db,E, E,Gb,Db.Hope that helpsCheers.Frantz.Just in case :Thriller.ns2p(547 Bytes) Downloaded 940 times

post_content: Hello everybody and good holidaysit's now few months that I'm using a Nord Stage 2EX, and during this period I surf on the forum looking for good sounds.I learn how to create a new patch with the "nord sample editor"(.nsmp), but I would like to understand how to crate a new organ sound or a new program!Because I have a XB-2 organ simulator, with the "Burn" effect, and I would like to create a program for my nord stage, using it's beautiful sound, but being also able to use the drawbars (like the Jon Lord sound that you can find inside the forum).I would like also to know how can I create a synth program, using LFO and all the other knobs.Thank you all!

title: RE: Create hammond
post_content: You can’t use the drawbars for samples...You can only play the 3 organ models and use the internal leslie - or take your laptop onstage..Logic or MainStage B3 supports using the drawbars by adding the parameters in MIDI.Just activate the Synth section and turn the knobs - it’s that simple...

title: Organ First Aid Kit
post_content: Hi Everyone!Just watched First Aid Kit and I've totally fallen in love with it's organ sound in the song "It's A Shame"! I think the keyboard player is playing a Nord (hidden in a Wurli style case) and was wondering if anyone would know which sound he is using?Cheers,Lauren x

title: RE: Organ First Aid Kit
post_content: 1.) Don't go by what people are using in a music video. It's extremely likely that the studio had completely different gear available.2.) That sounds like a Hammond, V3 vibrato, I'd try 8' and 1 3/5' drawbars (the 3rd and 7th drawbars from the left) for the basic character and add a bit more around the top (right-hand drawbars) until it more or less fits. Some distortion, maybe Leslie drive. Compress to taste.

title: RE: Organ First Aid Kit
post_content: Thanks Analogika! Really appreciate your help! your advice is spot on.Best,Lauren

title: Dancing on the ceiling Arpegiator riff
post_content: Hi, I am depping with a function band in a fortnight time and I was wandering if anyone could help me with Lionel Richtea's Dancing on the Ceiling?  I'm fine with everything apart from the arpegiator synth riff in the intro, has anyone attempted this?Many thanks

title: RE: Dancing on the ceiling Arpegiator riff
post_content: Well - One way to do it is to find an appropriate midi file  - like here:https://freemidi.org/download-15507-dan ... nel-richieImport that file in Logic (or similar)  -  Isolate the ARP -  fix it if it is wrong - I hear this is a little wrong.   Then play it in the key you want to use on stage with the instrument in Logic that sounds most realistic.Then record from Logic your intro to a wav file - then use Nord Sample manager to make a sample of the intro and asign that sample to a key. Split your keybed and play

title: RE: Nightwish
post_content: I played in a Nightwish tribute band a while ago, and I had to do an incredible amount of sound programming to make it all work. Unfortunately, the Nord Stage 2 is not really the best keyboard for many of these sounds. Tuomas Holopainen uses Korg Tritons for many of his keyboard sounds. In general terms, you would be better using sampled sounds rather than analog sounds for that big "orchestral" sound. Mixtures of standard sampled strings, brass and choirs will give you most of the basics, along with pianos from the Stage 2. You should be able to find some useful sampled sounds in the Nord library.Live, the orchestra, choirs and some keyboard parts are prerecorded and he plays mostly simpler chordal parts, riffs and solos on his Tritons, usually fairly standard string patches.it depends what you are doing. If you want to do it as much as possible like the records (eg for a tribute band), then you will need a lot more than just a Stage 2 to do this. If you are playing for yourself, or for example a cover band, then if you stick to the basic chords and riffs using pianos, strings, choirs, a few bell type sounds, plus some synth sounds for the solos, that should work well enough.For some of the synth leads and assorted other parts, you should be able to get workable sounds from the synth section of your Stage 2.Here's how I did it. If you compare this live demo to the original, you can see which parts I've left out or consolidated. (No overdubs apart from lead vocal and one sneaky one I did to cover up a weak spot).Storytime - single edit - Nightwish tribute band demo.Storytime - demo.mp3

title: RE: Nightwish
post_content: Nightwish is a great band, was even greater previously and used to be my favourite back in the time. They have used quite a lot of preset sounds, that you can get 1/1 if you just find the right ones from the respective synthesisers. Recently of course they have had massive layers of real orchestral sounds etc so the "realistic" synth sounds (that imitate orchestral sounds, flutes, etc) don't really stand out that much. As mentioned previously, the Nord's aren't really the best synths for recreating these kinds of sounds.Some presets that I've found are:- A02: BigStrings from the Korg A1^2 synthesis found from the N264/364 or X5D for example (the classic short-attack strings from multiple older songs)- A15: Adventure Bells from the Korg Trinity/TR-Rack (typical bells in f.ex. Dead to the World)- B34: Dream Theatre from the Korg Trinity/TR-Rack (intro of Sleeping Sun)

title: XL .npno soulds like S
post_content: Hi,any ideas what i could do wrong - i made space for an XL Grand and an XL upright in the sound manager (and my Stage 2 that i recently acquired) and opened the XL files in the sound manager and saw can find them in the "select piano" section on the Stage 2, but they sound like an S version... no difference in: 1/ simultaneous pressing  of 2 chords and 2/ the short adjecent pressing of the two chord while pressing the sustain pedal... I had the pleasure to hear the string resonances in a Stage 3, so they should be there in a XL file right?thanks for possible hints...

title: RE: XL .npno soulds like S
post_content: Have you activated the String Resonance in the Piano section, when using the XL?Also, there is a difference between the String (sympathetic) resonance, which happens between different keys pressed even if sustain pedal is not pressed (calculated/modeled) and what Nord calls "pedal down resonance" (samples)

title: Walk of Life
post_content: Hi AllI have been messing around with this for a while, tweeking it to get it right, and I think I have it close now. So I have the sound over the two slots (Stage 2 EX - 76 keys), keyboard split into 3, breaks at C5 and F6. Slot A has the B3 organ chords - Im not a good enough keyboard player to be messing with chords so simplified it for myself!!- (Lo) sampled (from the Stage 2 EX) and placed over keys E4, B3, A3 and G#3 and I have the initial organ sound (Vox-858003088) taking up the upper two keyboard breaks.Slot B  has another sample WalkofLife, which is the original organ Vox sound sampled together with the background string 5th notes layered over E6 to B6 (this sound is invoked by my control pedal), as well as the string sound that accompanies the verse layered over E5 to D# 6 (on the same sample). I hope this all makes sense. the original song is done with two keyboard players, so its been a challenge to get this right, and still allow yourself to rock out on stage...tried it for first time last Friday at a gig and the crowd went wild!! I have included both samples, as well as the programme file. Havent done an MP3 yet. Keen to get feedback.ThanksMuzza152

title: Watcher of the skies intro
post_content: Hello old Genesis fans,I've spent some time trying to recreate as close as possible the sound of the Tron+organ in the intro of WOTS.As you surely know, the original sound in the record (Foxtrot) was made with a double manual Mellotron MkII, with a mix of 3violins and Brass on the right manual, and a Bass Accordion on the left.On live performances different solutions were used, using a single-manual Mellotron 400, the Hammond organ and the bass pedalboard. Both Tron and Hammond were put into a Leslie.Here's my solution: I made a split with organ on left hand, and Tron mix on the right.Slot A: Organ (for the 2nd part of the intro) / Brass MkIISlot B: Organ (pedal-like sound) / 3violins MkIIMorph (wheel) between Organ-pedal and Organ 2nd part.All the Synth (Tron) are put into Rotary Speaker, in "stop" position, with a bit of Drive.Having used the Rotary for the Synths, I was forced to put the organ into a Twin simulation, with a bit a Drive.Comments, edits and improvements are very welcome. Enjoy it and ciao!

title: RE: Watcher of the skies intro
post_content: Hello friends,Yesterday I made the sample for the Electro 5. I've made it from the two seeded mellotron samples: 3 violins; 2 brasses. The file is 9.7 MB, but in Sund Manager it says 8 MB.I've made it this way:1. Created a midi with 3 semitone intervals starting at F#1, ending at C8. Same velocity every note.2. Played the midi twice: one for the violins and other for the brasses, saving both .wav files3. Mixed the files, balancing volumes (brasses sounded louder than violins4. Sampled with loops in every note, adjusting parameters in NSE trying to get the best jointThis is my first sample, so maybe it can be improved. If someone ask, I can send the .wav file to be sampled again.Hope it's useful,JapeWatcher of the Skies (intro).mp3

title: Big Brass with fall
post_content: Hey everyone ,I want to combine the big brass sound i found on this great forum with the brassfall effect but on modwheel. Does anyone know how to do that?Thank you in advance!!

title: RE: Big Brass with fall
post_content: Hi (and welcome),NS2 manualPage 19 -Morph Assign[hr]Assuming that you have loaded the necessary samples using the Nord Sound ManagerAssign one sample to synth on slot A, assign the other sample to synth on slot B.Set the wheel down and set the volume of the brass fall to zero. And the volume of brass sound to full.Double tap the wheel morph button and move the volume of the brass fall to the desired volume (up). Move the volume of the brass sound down (to zero?).Tap the wheel morph button.Activate both slots by pressing Slot A button and Slot B button at the same time.Good luck.GrBart

title: REQUEST; Sly & Family Stone Horn Section
post_content: Hey fellow Nord Lords!  I'm playing a Woodstock revival type show and I've been asked to cover the horn section for Sly & The Family Stone on Dance To The Music, Music Lover, and Higher.  I'm finding that the downloadable samples from the Nord site are a little cheesy sounding...or maybe need tweaking.  Does anyone have any horn section samples that might work for some snappy funk?!Thanks in advance!

title: RE: REQUEST; Sly & Family Stone Horn Section
post_content: in my opinion, there is no samples that could be as good as a real horn section in a funk song.....You will always miss the "Snap" and "intensity" of the all brass section like in September (Earth Winf and Fire...) or the songs you asked for. But if you check this website, I had good experiences with some pop/brass samples or even "full sustain" of full "fall section". I got them a while ago and they work for "I feel good", "Sledgehammer" etc....Ok, I usually layer them with some other samples from my VX5080 or the Proteus 2000...But I always miss the real articulation of a real brass player but it does the trick in a cover band situation.I'm assuming that if you use big samples libraries on computer you will get even closer but just with Nord Samples you will be a bit short...It all depends on how realistic they want you to be....But honestly, I Start to be a little bit upset by other members who always ask you to cover some stuff that you are not even supposed to do, as a keyboard player.Here is a thread about brass samples:http://www.norduserforum.com/nord-elect ... 13602.htmlBut I start to think like "Gambold", he said in different posts that the more you try to emulate real acoustic instruments, the more the band will always ask you to play other parts that keys and will turn/Shift you away form the basic, playing keys....So, I don't want to discourage you but make sure you won't end up being told :"Well, look at that, this new Rolling Stone song, you will have a blast in doing the Sax solo!!!!"...Well, for sure, it's really hard to distinguish even a small amount of organ in the song...Ok, sorry for being maybe too much negative but to get the best brass samples, you need to get a good and pure samples box...Shouls I say that the Roland Integra 7 has some?

title: RE: REQUEST; Sly & Family Stone Horn Section
post_content: Many pop songs that feature horns also have a B3 organ playing along with those horn parts. You might try playing some organ parts *instead* of horn sounds - this might work better than horn sounds on some songs, especially since it is difficult to emulate the breath attack of horn parts from a keyboard. I say this as someone who plays sax as his main instrument.

title: RE: REQUEST; Sly & Family Stone Horn Section
post_content: Thanks for the replies. I usually comp on organ for the horn parts, but there is actually going to be another keyboard player doing the organ parts for Sly and they want the horns in there.  Ill do my best!

title: RE: REQUEST; Sly & Family Stone Horn Section
post_content: I also think that blending samples with synthesized brass-like sounds makes for an effective combination.-dj

title: Nord Stage 2 How to Level Volume on Switching Programmes
post_content: Hi can anyone helpI have a Nord Stage 2.  I usually  have a sound guy for live gigs but am in another band now where this probably won't be a feature at the outset.  Had big problems in achieving a level volume (through PA), in rehearsal  switching between different programmes and tabs.  Am wondering if I set and save volume of each programme/tab to same decibels, if this will level the volume.  Your advice would be really appreciated…ThanksSally

title: RE: Nord Stage 2 How to Level Volume on Switching Programmes
post_content: On the NS2 you cannot save a master volume, only the volume of each Section; you have to program carefully yourpatches so that you level them to the same final/overall desired output volume (not a trivial task, you can search and find many discussions on this forum about levelling volumes of NS patches...)

title: RE: Nord Stage 2 How to Level Volume on Switching Programmes
post_content: Hi maxpianoSo if i set each patch to say 0.0db do you think this would give the same output level for every patch i save to that volume?Sally

title: RE: Nord Stage 2 How to Level Volume on Switching Programmes
post_content: Hi Sally,In "the old days" one would connect keyboard to tape recorder, hit the RECORD button (and PAUSE) and use the recorder's meters to measure output levels of different programs and balance them out.  These days there are probably freeware apps which could do this.The db settings on the instrument will not do this.  Consider for a moment that if you have all 9 ninebars all the way out the B3 organ the audio output will be much louder than if all 9 drawbars except 1 are all the way in despite being set to 0.0dB in each case.  Same is true for samples and potentially pianos.  There will be natural variations in volumes of different sounds.Measuring actual output with a meter will be the best way for optimal results.Bless,Pablo

title: RE: Nord Stage 2 How to Level Volume on Switching Programmes
post_content: pablomastodon wrote:Consider for a moment that if you have all 9 ninebars all the way out the B3 organ the audio output will be much louder than if all 9 drawbars except 1 are all the way in despite being set to 0.0dB in each case.In the other hand, this should be this way in the case of organ registrations.But not for diferent pianos and synths.Ramon

title: RE: Nord Stage 2 How to Level Volume on Switching Programmes
post_content: Sal-FloydonNord2 wrote:Hi maxpianoSo if i set each patch to say 0.0db do you think this would give the same output level for every patch i save to that volume?SallyTheoretically yes but the problem, as Pablo also suggested is: how and in which conditions will you measure that 0dB?The actual volume while playing is affected by many factors, e.g. velocity or expression pedal (if used) or changing drawbar settings in case of the Hammond, so "measuring 0dB" should include considerations about "at which velocity, ... I want to get that value"? Probably we'd say " when I am at the max of all parameters affecting final output Volume", but consider also the NS is a "live"machine so temptation/opportunity to change something on the fly if feel you can't hear yourself right, too loud or too low, will always be there.Bottom line my suggestion is to use (your) common sense and don't be afraid to have to undergo some iterative adjustments, till you get to the result you like, rather than expecting a perfect 0dB measure to solve it all.

title: RE: Nord Stage 2 How to Level Volume on Switching Programmes
post_content: As Max correctly mentioned, there are many factors involved here.  The point of the control is that when that setting is raised one is adding gain and when it is lowered the signal is attenuated.  The physical number is not and can not used as a final measure of actual output volume.  Meaningful signal metering can only occur after the analog audio outputs.

title: RE: Nord Stage 2 How to Level Volume on Switching Programmes
post_content: Thanks for your time guys that was really useful.  I appear to have 3 options:1. The common sense approach/undergoing iterative adjustments (If i use my monitors at home to try to level volumes, will the levels I set sound equally as level when i run the Nord through a PA system)?2. Locate freeware app or3. Meter for measuring actual outputCan anyone recommend any freeware app or meter compatible for Nord Stage 2?  (Price not too prohibitive)..

title: RE: Nord Stage 2 How to Level Volume on Switching Programmes
post_content: The biggest problem is the assumption that everyone else in the band is under control. They are not, as your sound guy knows all too well.You can only level out as best you can across the presets, but without a sound guy, you actually need a good sound mix through the monitors in my experience. Only then can you adjust your levels live to get a decent balance.I just do my best using the volumes per section to set a balance, then wing it if there is no sound guy......

title: RE: Nord Stage 2 How to Level Volume on Switching Programmes
post_content: dB says very little about apparent loudness. Two sounds at the same dB may appear to have VERY different levels.In addition, sounds may need to be much softer in the band context — Oberheim horns need to blare at full volume when you're playing the intro to "Jump!", but if you're backing "Easy Lover", the same sound will need to be MUCH lower to blend with piano and the rest of the band.Trust your ears and put a trusted friend in the audience to keep notes for you on what sounds are too loud/too soft. This is the MUCH harder part of sound design for a band. I built the sounds for a cover band within about two weeks, but it took me well over six months' constant work with our sound engineer to get the most egregious volume outliers reigned in.

title: RE: Nord Stage 2 How to Level Volume on Switching Programmes
post_content: those damned egregious outliers!

title: RE: Nord Stage 2 How to Level Volume on Switching Programmes
post_content: pablomastodon wrote:those damned egregious outliers!You know you've hit one when the frontman turns around and glares at you…or, better yet, explains to the audience over the mic that this would be a great time for the piano to tone it down, as he's trying to talk to the audience.

title: RE: Maroon 5 Live (Moves like Jagger)
post_content: I had a gig last night. Usually I bring two keyboards, a Nord Electro 4HP and a Nord Lead 2, and on Moves like jagger I usually play that lead hook on the Lead and a synth pad on the Electro. But last night I only brought the Electro, and as you know it's not multi timbral and I had no suitable lead sound sample available. So what to do when this song came up? Unrehearsed! About five seconds before counting in, I decided to use a Rhodes sound instead (EPiano1 I think), and played both the lead hook and the chords on that. And it worked like a charm! The song became more funky, and people danced like never before!! Amazing!So why am I telling you this? We'll I believe that limitations forces us to be creative. So instead of trying to sound like someone else, I decided to sound like myself, and as a result I played a whole lot better, and the audience enjoyed it even more. So, don't lose yourself in endless search for that perfect sound. Let your personality shine through.

title: RE: SUPERSTITION
post_content: My superstition is as follows:1 split pointbottom part:Slot A: Brass Sec Pop 1Slot B: HornTrio&Barytontop part:Slot A: Clavinet model 'b' Clav EQ Treb & Mid only. Effects: Delay Rate = 30% Amount = 20% small amount of Stage1 reverb.Works for me and cuts well through the mix. Just a shame there are no REALLY good horns available for the Stage...

title: RE: SUPERSTITION
post_content: There are many tracks in the original. If you are trying to cover this in a band, you might consider not trying to duplicate the original, but instead to apologetically make your version different. Here is one person who did this with excellent results:

title: RE: SUPERSTITION
post_content: harmonizer wrote:There are many tracks in the original. If you are trying to cover this in a band, you might consider not trying to duplicate the original, but instead to apologetically make your version different. Here is one person who did this with excellent results:... uhhh, no offense, but this comment is extremely unhelpful on a thread about trying to get the right clav sound for a specific iconic song.  The youtube version you have posted *includes no clav*.  It's not a bad one man rendition, but is completely unresponsive to the thread at hand.  You might as well have posted the SRV version.For the record, I don't have any great suggestions about matching the sound of the original track.  I basically tend to stay on the "A" model clav with Brilliance and Treble EQ mods enabled for just about everything for which I use clav.  I use auto wah 1 (or, lately,  an external filter pedal) and phaser to fatten up the sound a little and add some more variety to my overall output.  I do agree that this should probably be a factory pre-set available in the programs, because it is such an iconic sound and part.

title: RE: SUPERSTITION
post_content: Use AD setting. To make the sound stand out I use the auto wah and one of the amp models with slight distortion. Stevie plays his clavinet sound really clean, also remember that there are two clavparts you need to be two players to fully cover the song, I always lean towards that it is more important to get the groove right than to have a perfect copy of The original clavinet sound.

title: Turn Me Loose
post_content: Mr G posted a description of a cool technique for using the detune to get multiple notes on a single key press:http://www.norduserforum.com/post41167.html#p41167I had used this same technique as well for doing the intro to the Lover Boy song, Turn Me Loose. The second quick note has to be hit after the first low note is released, the third octave has to be played before releasing the second so the glide takes place. Works at the original tempo of the record. I also included the other patch I use for the song which has the poly synth in the left split and the percussive sound in the right.Patch is here, no samples needed--djTMLGlide.mp3

title: Nord Sound Manager Compatibility
post_content: Hi everybody,I have a Nord Stage 2 / 76 and I have to travel to another country to play a gig and they only have the nord stage 2 compact. Does anybody know, if I download my sounds on the Nord Sound Manager, can I then upload them on the nord stage 2 compact? Is it the same .ns2b format?Thanks

title: RE: Nord Sound Manager Compatibility
post_content: Yes.

title: RE: Nord Sound Manager Compatibility
post_content: Maybe make sure that you take with you the same sound manager program version you made the backup with and you also have the same OS version in both instruments. Perhaps the safest would be updating yours to the latest version, then make the back up AND takeg with you the instrument OS update file as well. If the rented one has an old OS version you can update it to the latest one.

title: RE: Nord Sound Manager Compatibility
post_content: Depending on the number of sounds you need to load for your gig, it may be more efficient to use Bundles vs. doing a complete backup. The backup takes some time and can be a little bit clunky. Bundles load a bit faster and it's less stressful in the moment. If you want to go that route, let us know and I can dig up another thread that has details on it.

title: RE: Nord Sound Manager Compatibility
post_content: Good points Mr_G (I was a bit too concise)@ericL: just an additional comment to your suggestion; with a Backup you get also all the System/Sound/MIDI settings restored, which you don't get with Bundles. So the choice of which method need also to take this aspect into account.

title: RE: Nord Sound Manager Compatibility
post_content: Good points, all.  Bundle is way more efficient for speed, but if the underlying programming contains much exotic System/Midi/External settings, those will also need to be recreated manually from scratch, whereas with a full Backup it's no-fuss, no-muss, simple turnkey operation.  Just takes a lot longer.

title: How can a Program(Organ) sound over another program (Piano)?
post_content: Hello everybody. I am in a real need. Tomorrow we have a concert with our band,and I have recently bought NORD STAGE 2 EX 88. However,there is one thing I am not able to do and need to do it this evening.QUESTION/SCENARIO:I have ORGAN program (sound) selected, I play a chord, I am still holding the chord,during that I switch the program to PIANO and I need to have the ORGAN still soundedwhile I am holding the keys. This function is really a common thing for any YAMAHA STAGE PIANOs (I've used before)but here, on NORD, when I switch between the programs the previous program is CUT IMMIDIATLEY, no matter if I still hold the keys,or hold the pedal... this is really bad when I need to crossfade/overlap the sounds within a song smoothly...Can please someone give any advice or point me where can I have the answer?Manual is what I read, but I did not see there any help...Thanks lot lot lot!!Peter

title: RE: How can a Program(Organ) sound over another program (Piano)?
post_content: Simple answer: You can't... unless you have the new Nord Stage 3But it will only be out as of July.Nord Stage 2 EX cuts the sound whenchanging program.Solution:Organ on A slot.Piano on B Slot.Going from A slot to B slot doesn't cut the sound.There you go.

title: RE: How can a Program(Organ) sound over another program (Piano)?
post_content: No way!!!First of all thanks for the reply!And for second: whyyyyyyy?????It is really the worst timing from my side! I never knew this when buying it,and if I waited just 3 more months, just 3 more!!! Gosh!Well... let's try the slots... that is at least something, and again, thanks for reply!Peter

title: RE: How can a Program(Organ) sound over another program (Piano)?
post_content: BTW,If your left hand is holding the chords and you use your right hand only for piano... look for the split function. All on one slot then.But if you need full keyboard for organ THEN full keyboard for piano, then slot A slot B is your only solution.

title: RE: How can a Program(Organ) sound over another program (Piano)?
post_content: You are really very helpfull and I do not know how else to thank you, but just to thank youAnyway... The Slots seem to be the half solution here,and indeed it is the best I can have so I take it. However I am confused about one thing. I am not sure how to set following scenario:PRESSED SLOT A - gives me PIANO sound, since that bank and that program is chosen (this is ok, I like it, but now)CHANGE TO SLOT B - How will I put there EG MELLOTRON considering that when I press MELLOTRON anytime, it simply IS BY DESIGN with SLOT A?Got my point? When I do just basic thing as searching throu the programms, I noticed that some of them are somehow assigned for SLOT A and some of them are assigned for SLOT B... by design: the slot switches automatically when I switch the programm.I have already leart from the manual that you can copy any setting from one Slot to another, but I am not sure this is what would help here...ALSO... I was considering to use another option> spliting the keyboard into 3 parts -> as simple as cake,but, I noticed that I most likely cannot have two different porgrams from ONE SECTION (ORGAN SECTION, PIANO SECTION, SYNTH SECTION) at the same time on the split keyboard. I cannot have e.g. this:LO - PIANOUP - MELOTRONEHIGH - E PIANOOr can I but am I just not clever enough yet??This would solve my problem, since I could most likely also adjust the octave settings (move the octaves within one split)...Gosh, a lot of questions for you, but you are the saviour here...THanks

title: RE: How can a Program(Organ) sound over another program (Piano)?
post_content: You can have those 3 sounds in a split and even using a single Slot, because they use 3 distinct sections  (Mellotron uses the Synth).To the other question, you are missing a key concept of NS: every Program includes both slots, even if one only is active, so you cannot copy a Program into a single slot but ... you can copy slots between different programs (keep a slot button pressed and browse for the Program/Slot you want to copy from).Last not least... I recommend you read the manual very carefully and try what you read on the NS while you read it.PS: if you wan to thank someone (not necessarily me) for a reply, you can click the "Thanks" button on the message you want to thank for.

title: Red Giant Library available for Nord Stage 2!!!!
post_content: Do you like?????Red Giant Library -Custom Sound Library for Nord Electro 5 series and Nord Stage 2 series!Programmed by Anthony PanebiancoRed Giant Library is created for the serious keyboard player who need great sound under his fingertips, the library explore about 3 decade of synthesis, plus 5 "Superstar Patches" prepared for specific songs (see list below)Patches list: 28 Programs (Electro 5) 22 Programs (Stage 2)RG The Funk SectionRG 80s SuperPolySawRG Analog Hand ArpRG BelIs WorldRG Be or not B (electro 5 only)RG BlackFire Flute (electro 5 only)RG Call as MariaRG DancePoly DelayRG Fernet OrganRG Funk RevolutionRG Godfather SicilyRG Gothica PipeChor (electro 5 only)RG Japan Stardust (electro 5 only)RG Heads HunterRG Legend FilterRG Nostalgia TrackRG Lunar Rhodes (electro 5 only)RG Other World Keys (electro 5 only)RG Perc SynthRG Shankar DreamsRG Sphere BellishRG Stevie The DuckRG SuperPhased PadRG Here I Go Again - SUPERSTAR PATCH (Abba)RG Tribute ELP - SUPERSTAR PATCH (ELP)RG In the Mirror - SUPERSTAR PATCH (M. Jackson)RG JustOneSolution - SUPERSTAR PATCH (Queen)RG Ground ClavBrass - SUPERSTAR PATCH (S.Wonder)

title: RE: Patch request: Can't Stop The Feeling
post_content: Setting up patch today . sounds like a lot of side chaining going on if you listen to the instrumental.Was Trying to work out how to replicate the side chained piano for intro, and verse. Sounds like it's sidecained to a muted kick, deducts on beat 1,2,3&4.guess tremolo is perfect.Don't really hear much of a pad until the second half of prechorus first time round. It sounds more like piano filtered. There's sweeps/white noise.Second prechorus sounds like a few  additional synths pretty low in mix.Pad would be good to think enough a think piano sample.Chorus, sounds like a couple of synths, I would say keep tremolo on them as well. Additionally there's synth brass.

title: Save A Prayer
post_content: Hi everyone,I've certainly benefited from the efforts of the programmers here and I'm hoping I can give back something of use.I was listening to Duran Duran's Save A Prayer today. I know that someone once nailed this program for the original Stage, but there's nothing here for the NS2 series.This is my first ever attempt to program anything specific on my NS2EX. I can't get over how easy this keyboard is to program, and how much you can do with just one oscillator.I know I didn't come as close as the other program, but I'm hoping this is a good starting point for tweaking to your liking.Slot A is the sequence with the heavy delay. Slot B is the lead. Unfortunately because of the pitch bend limit you can't recreate the pitch jump of the original song. You can cheat a little by playing the high C and then using the pitch bend on the lower notes. I couldn't show it in my demo video because I'm not set up to do overhead shots and play with two hands like some of you othersIf you find it helpful, please let me know! If you improve on it, by all means re-upload it here.[youtube][/youtube]

title: RE: Save A Prayer
post_content: Thank you so so much for this one!

title: RE: Save A Prayer
post_content: My pleasure. I hope you find it useful!

title: Blondie Heart of Glass
post_content: Hi all, I'm not very technical and am hoping someone can help me. I'm trying to replicate the keyboard sounds for the Blondie song Heart of Glass on my Nord Stage  2, has anyone created a patch? Any help/tips would be much appreciated

title: RE: Blondie Heart of Glass
post_content: There is a Farfisa organ through a Leslie. That part and the synth sweep can be easily done on the Stage using the organ and synth section.The bass part is the tricky part. It was originally a Roland SH-1000 (or SH-5 according tothis source) triggered by a Roland CR-78 drum machine.Source:the making of video.

title: In the air tonight synth ?
post_content: Hi,I normally play some hard rock, and not very familiar with synth sounds,but I've got a request to play In the air tonight by Phil Collins.Someone have a suggestion for the main synth ?Thanks

title: RE: In the air tonight synth ?
post_content: Was a Prophet 5 on the original recording - there are lots of nice muted synth pads in the Nord library that will do the trick. When I used to play this tune I had a filter swell programmed into the aftertouch for accents.Check out:http://www.nordkeyboards.com/sound-libr ... -2-0/synthandhttp://www.nordkeyboards.com/sound-libr ... og-stringsDH

title: RE: In the air tonight synth ?
post_content: Hi Guys,After having read a lot about analog/substractive synthesis (and still being a newbie in creating sounds even if I have a NL2X and a Prophet 08), I decided to give it a go with this simple pad...First I will do it on my Prophet 08.Second, I want to start from scratch as the sounds that I found into my factory bank are too "sweepy" for this pad (too much filter sweep....). By the way how I remove the sweep? Decreasing the amount of LFO sent to te frequency of the filter?Third, I need some advices from our fantastic people in the forum, so :1) WaveWhat kind of Wave for Osc1?Triangle, Pw, Sine, square, sawtooth? (Cannot find the thread were it was explain what kind of wave to use for brass, strings etc...)2) Os 4 poles can resonate). I heard that the 2 poles is 12db/Oct then softer than the 4 poles?4) ADSRAttack soft, sustain a little bit lower that the max, decay fast, release quite long?5) FILTER ENVWhat settings? Do I need to apply a lot, I don't think so because the pad doesn't evolve a lot in this song....6) Any advices on Keyboard tracking etc?7) LFOApplied on the Osc or Filter? Or on Envelop for kind of slow Phasing or Chorus?8) any other guidance before I start this WE ?Thanks a lot in advance...Sincerely

title: RE: In the air tonight synth ?
post_content: Just find a pad that comes close and start turning knobs... That way you will learn what the knobs do.And watch some tutorials on ADSR. oscilators etc.You could also download thefree Prophet 5 Demo from Arturia. Find a pad that sounds similar and look how all the knobs and sliders are set. Copy it on your 08.

title: Does anyone have a sound for Yes-"Owner of a lonely heart"
post_content: For using in my NS2. Thanks in advance !!!

title: RE: Does anyone have a sound for Yes-"Owner of a lonely heart"
post_content: If you are looking to copy the keyboards on the record it's going to be very difficult, if not impossible. The arrangement uses lots of very short parts with a lot of different sounds and unique samples, some of them virtually impossible to reproduce. There is no overall single keyboard part or sound for the whole song. It is made more complicated because the guitar also has a lot of important separate parts and unusual sounds, which might be difficult for a single guitarist to cover on stage, meaning you might need to think about playing some of the guitar parts yourself, depending on what your guitar player decides to do. Unless you're a very experienced player and programmer, you might be better off coming up with your own version of the song.

title: PYT?
post_content: Shocked to discover nobody's ever posted a program with sounds for Michael Jackson's PYT.  Anybody out there in Nord land ever done the leg work?

title: RE: PYT?
post_content: Here's astarting point:The “P.Y.T.” synth noodle that answers the chorus vocal. That was a Roland Jupiter-6 “wang bar”-style pitch bend doubled with, and controlling, a Sequential Circuits Prophet-5, thus the sort of smear you can hear on the “wobble” between the top two notes. I recall the keyboards were set on the very top of a stand so they were practically at ear level!

title: Phlake synth lead
post_content: Hi Forum,I'm looking for the sound of the synth lead from Phlake - Pregnant (0:35 min in the video), can anybody help me creating that?I want to have a split program with a rhode sound in the lower-middle part and then the lead synth in the upper part.It sounds like they are using some kind of effect on a aftertouch to control a tremolo/vibrato or a overdrive.I hope someone have the time and skills to help me.Thank you in advanceCheers Rasmus

title: RE: Phlake synth lead
post_content: Hej RasmusI don't have my keyboard at hand right now, so unfortunately I can't have my go at replicating the sound.My recommendation would be to find a good synth sound to use as a base (I would try to see if an analog type (maybe a square wave) would do the trick - maybe someone else has a suggestion as to which synthesis type to use?) and then adjust the release time to fit. Try dialing in a fair amount of overdrive. I think the amount of overdrive can be left fairly high - even from the beginning of the line.However, I think the panning might have been done after recording the sound. If you want to achieve a similar effect live I would recommend using the "A-PAN"-effect and assigning the "AMOUNT" knob to either the mod wheel or aftertouch.I hope this will get you a little closer to the actual sound.And looking forward to see if someone else has any suggestions.- Frederik

title: RE: Hohner Electric Piano

title: RE: Hohner Electric Piano
post_content: The Duo has three additional switches and a pot below the tone switches.Cees' keyboard there has only a single on/off switch below the tone settings, as on an E7.

title: Synth
